Rumsfeld also faulted the administration for failing to work with Congress on drafting policies for treatment of prisoners. Looking back, I see there are things the administration could have done differently and better with respect to wartime detention, he wrote. The accounts of the book also quote Rumsfeld as criticizing his colleagues in the President Bush administration, including both of President Bush 's secretaries of state, Colin Powell and later Condoleezza Rice .
